title: Bring RelativePanel to WPF vNext
body:
On MWC 2015 Microsoft unveiled new WinRT control RelativePanel that allows simple relative placing of controls next to each other using attached property rules.
It would be really useful to have the same RelativePanel available in classic WPF as well.

comments.body:
Time to open source WPF if Microsoft no longer want to add awesomeness like this RelativePanel. Setup a repository, let us make poll requests and we'll give WPF the love.
My industry has been using WPF since 2009 and we would love to have more parity between WPF and the new goodies in UWP. Bring controls over and also let us host UWP "regions" inside of WPF like you did with WPF --> WinForms, and Winforms--> Win32 etc.
I support this 100%. Bring all the features to WPF :)

I would love to see this. However, until then, I created this control library that'll give you a RelativePanel in WPF with 100% compatible syntax:
https://github.com/dotMorten/UniversalWPF
That would be great if it was added
Doubt we'll get this, but it would be very nice.
